From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /oɾɡaniˈθaɾ/ [oɾ.ɡa.niˈθaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: or‧ga‧ni‧zar

Verb

[edit]

organizar (first-person singular indicative present organizo, past participle organizáu)

  1. to organize

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of organizar
infinitive organizar
gerund organizando
past participle m organizáu, f organizada, n organizao, m pl organizaos, f pl organizaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present organizo organizes organiza organizamos organizáis organizen
imperfect organizaba organizabes organizaba organizábemos, organizábamos organizabeis, organizabais organizaben
preterite organizé organizasti, organizesti organizó organizemos organizastis, organizestis organizaron
pluperfect organizare, organizara organizares, organizaras organizare, organizara organizáremos, organizáramos organizareis, organizarais organizaren, organizaran
future organizaré organizarás organizará organizaremos organizaréis organizarán
conditional organizaría organizaríes organizaría organizaríemos, organizaríamos organizaríeis, organizaríais organizaríen
subjunctive present organize organizes, organizas organize organizemos organizéis organizen, organizan
imperfect organizare, organizara organizares, organizaras organizare, organizara organizáremos, organizáramos organizareis, organizarais organizaren, organizaran
imperative — organiza — — organizái —

Derived terms

[edit]
  • organización

Further reading

[edit]
  • “organizar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN

Galician

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • IPA(key): /ɔɾɡaniˈθaɾ/ [ɔɾ.ɣ̞ɑ.niˈθaɾ]
  • IPA(key): (standard) /ɔɾɡaniˈθaɾ/ [ɔɾ.ɣ̞ɑ.niˈθaɾ]
  • IPA(key): (gheada) /ɔɾħaniˈθaɾ/ [ɔɾ.ħɑ.niˈθaɾ]
  • IPA(key): (gheada and seseo) /ɔɾħaniˈsaɾ/ [ɔɾ.ħɑ.niˈsaɾ]

  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Hyphenation: or‧ga‧ni‧zar

Verb

[edit]

organizar (first-person singular present organizo, first-person singular preterite organicei, past participle organizado)
organizar (first-person singular present organizo, first-person singular preterite organizei, past participle organizado, reintegrationist norm)

  1. to organize

Derived terms

[edit]
  • organización

Further reading

[edit]
  • “organizar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025
  • “organizar”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025
  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, editor (2006–2013), “organizar”, in Dicionario de Dicionarios da lingua galega [Dictionary of Dictionaries of the Galician language] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, Ernesto Xosé González Seoane, María Álvarez de la Granja, editors (2003–2018), “organizar”, in Tesouro informatizado da lingua galega (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Rosario Álvarez Blanco, editor (2014–2024), “organizar”, in Tesouro do léxico patrimonial galego e portugués (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega, →ISSN

Ido

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Esperanto organizi, English organize, French organiser, German organisieren, Italian organizzare, Russian организо́вывать (organizóvyvatʹ), Spanish organizar. By surface analysis, organo (“instrument, means”) +‎ -izar (“to cover with, add to, supply with”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /or.ɡa.ni.ˈzar/, /oɾ.ɡa.ni.ˈzaɾ/

Verb

[edit]

organizar (present tense organizas, past tense organizis, future tense organizos, imperative organizez, conditional organizus)

  1. (transitive) to organize
    Antonym: desorganizar

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of organizar
present past future
infinitive organizar organizir organizor
tense organizas organizis organizos
conditional organizus — —
imperative organizez — —
adjective active participle organizanta organizinta organizonta
adverbial active participle organizante organizinte organizonte
nominal
active participle 		singular organizanto organizinto organizonto
plural organizanti organizinti organizonti
adjective passive participle organizata organizita organizota
adverbial passive participle organizate organizite organizote
nominal
passive participle 		singular organizato organizito organizoto
plural organizati organiziti organizoti

Derived terms

[edit]
  • organizala (“organizational”)
  • organizero (“organizer”)
  • organizeso (“organization, plant”)
  • organizo (“organization”)
  • organizuro (“organization, plant”)

Related terms

[edit]
  • organala (“organic”)
  • organaro (“plant”)
  • organeto (“organelle”)
  • organo (“instrument, means”)

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French organiser, from New Latin organizāre (“to organize”), from Latin organum (“organ”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /oʁ.ɡa.niˈza(ʁ)/ [oɦ.ɡa.niˈza(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /oʁ.ɡa.niˈza(ʁ)/ [oɦ.ɡa.niˈza(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /oɾ.ɡa.niˈza(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /oʁ.ɡa.niˈza(ʁ)/ [oʁ.ɡa.niˈza(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /oɻ.ɡa.niˈza(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔɾ.ɡɐ.niˈzaɾ/ [ɔɾ.ɣɐ.niˈzaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔɾ.ɡɐ.niˈzaɾ/ [ɔɾ.ɣɐ.niˈzaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɔɾ.ɡɐ.niˈza.ɾi/ [ɔɾ.ɣɐ.niˈza.ɾi]

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: or‧ga‧ni‧zar

Verb

[edit]

organizar (first-person singular present organizo, first-person singular preterite organizei, past participle organizado)

  1. to organize

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of organizar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person

Impersonal organizar
Personal organizar organizares organizar organizarmos organizardes organizarem

organizando

Feminine organizada organizadas
Indicative

Imperfect organizava organizavas organizava organizávamos organizáveis organizavam
Preterite organizei organizaste organizou organizamos1, organizámos2 organizastes organizaram
Pluperfect organizara organizaras organizara organizáramos organizáreis organizaram
Future organizarei organizarás organizará organizaremos organizareis organizarão
Conditional organizaria organizarias organizaria organizaríamos organizaríeis organizariam

Imperfect organizasse organizasses organizasse organizássemos organizásseis organizassem

Imperative

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Further reading

[edit]
  • “organizar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “organizar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “organizar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “organizar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “organizar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “organizar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French organiser, from Medieval Latin organizāre, from Latin organum (“organ”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /oɾɡaniˈθaɾ/ [oɾ.ɣ̞a.niˈθaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /oɾɡaniˈsaɾ/ [oɾ.ɣ̞a.niˈsaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: or‧ga‧ni‧zar

Verb

[edit]

organizar (first-person singular present organizo, first-person singular preterite organicé, past participle organizado)

  1. to organize
    Antonym: desorganizar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of organizar (c-z alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund organizando
past participle masculine feminine
singular organizado organizada
plural organizados organizadas
singular plural

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of organizar (c-z alternation)

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

accusative organícenme not used organícenlo, organícenla organícennos not used organícenlos, organícenlas, organícense

Derived terms

[edit]
  • crimen organizado

Related terms

[edit]
  • organización
